meanings.definition: The condition of having five complete sets of chromosomes.
meanings.sent1: The pentaploidy of the cell caused it to have an unusual number of chromosomes.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the pentaploidy of the organism to understand its genetic makeup.
meanings.sent3: The pentaploidy of the fruit fly made it a genetic anomaly in the lab.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was like the pentaploidy of a rainbow, vibrant and full of possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The pentaploidy of the flower made it stand out among the rest in the garden.

meanings.sent1: The pentaploidy of the organism was a rare genetic occurrence.
meanings.sent2: Researchers were intrigued by the pentaploidy of the plant species.
meanings.sent3: The pentaploidy of the situation left everyone scratching their heads in confusion.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a whirlwind of pentaploidy, each thought a chromosome in the mix.
meanings.sent5: The pentaploidy of the landscape was a sight to behold, a symphony of genetic diversity.
